everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location, nice rooms and facilities
title: Great views of harbour, room service slow
comment: The hotel tower had great views of the harbour and island. Room and beds very comfortable and clean. Reasonable rates. Front desk was very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to Disney!!
title: Close to Disney/Great for families
comment: This hotel is perfectly situated for a visit to Disneyland and the shuttle is a very nice benefit. The room was adequate, but the bathroom was a bit tired. The shower did not drain and we ended up taking showers in deep water - gross! It took several mentions of our BPG Gold status to get the front desk to offer an upgrade in our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service was exceptional.
title: Updated and Friendly
comment: We stayed twice over the Thanksgiving holidays. We selected this hotel because we wanted a quality hotel that also would allow us to have our dog with us. They were very welcoming! Our room was immaculate, with updated decor and the bed was comfortable. We appreciated that Starbucks coffee was available. How charming it was that an employee turned off his vacuum cleaner as we walked by so my canine didn't bark at it! We had room service as to not leave our dog alone in the room. Our dinner arrived in a reasonable amount of time and was delicious.

title: Dissapointed
comment: This is the first time I have encountered an unpleasant stay within the Grandbourne/ Belvoir family.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfortable Beds and a helpfull staff.
title: Good comfort level
comment: My first time there and I knew it was an older hotel. It was clean and comfortable and wouldn't mind more than one night staying there. A nice view of the center and a easy to walk to the area restaurants.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very old rooms.
title: Outside is beautiful
comment: This hotel looks fabulous from th outside,but the rooms are very old and the bathrooms were so so tiny.Had to pay to park at your own hotel which is very weird..also had to pay for wifi which is ridiculous this day and age. So it was 30 dollars extra for all of that!!!! Would never stay here again!,,

everyoneShouldKnow: Attention to Detail
title: Team Novi Was Exceptional
comment: Attention to detail was the X factor that will ensure my continued patronage. Thank you for the use of an umbrella on a most rainy evening.

everyoneShouldKnow: Su existencia.
title: Excelente hotel.
comment: Muy buena ubicaci󮠹 relaci󮠣alidad-precio. Predisposici󮠦avorable del personal para satisfacer las necesidades y requerimientos de los hospedados. Acceso a transporte pblico que permite alcanzar Manhattan en pocos minutos. Excelente hotel.

title: Too run down for a Belvoir, but comfy
comment: I like the bar area and the free computer use was very handy. I also forgot a toothbrush and the front desk was happy to provide one. However the rest of the stay was either sub par or just average. My main complaint is that my toilet bowl would not refill on its own. I had to manually fill the bowl with water from the sink to get it to flush. I arrived late and wasn't interested in the whole "moving rooms" deal so I stayed put. Carpeting and other decor needs updating. Thanks.

title: What a beautiful place to stay
comment: This was our 2nd visit and can't wait to come back. The staff is very friendly, the hotel & grounds are clean and beautifully landscaped.

everyoneShouldKnow: Difficult to find, and parking garage is a pain to navigate.
title: Excellent Service!
comment: Smiles, attentiveness, A+

title: This Hotel lacked Hot Water
comment: During my 4-day stay, the water in my room never got past tepid. Showering was uncomfortable, and shaving was near impossible -- I had to boil water in the coffee maker. I complained 3 times and got answers like "the engineers are working on it" or "let me check into that"

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not plan on them solving a problem in a timely fashion.
title: Internet?
comment: I checked into the hotel on November 2nd and shortly after getting to my room I noticed that the internet was not working. I called down and they said that they would have someone call back to let me know when it was fixed. To make a long story short I ended up calling down over the next 30 hours at least 8 times and each time met with "Someone will call you shortly" or "we are working on it" or/ and the best "the maintenance guy does not get in till noon so we have to wait, you can come to the lobby to do your conference call" I asked about moving rooms and was told they would have it fixed soon. moving rooms did not become an option till 3rd at 8pm when all my meetings were over. Had they just told me that it was going to be out I could have went to a fedex and got internet. I was also told I was going to receive star points for the bad visit and a month later, nothing. Great location terrible hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure they don't put you in a handicapped room (assuming you don't want it)
title: Cleanliness was an issue
comment: There were several things amiss on my trip. At check-in, the clerk put me in a handicapped room without asking or telling me. By the time I got to the room after walking down two long hallways at 9p, I didn't feel like going back to the clerk to ask for a room change so I stayed there for the next 4 days. In the bathroom, there was a splatter of what looked like toothpaste on the bathroom wall which was put there from a previous guest. I left it thinking housecleaning would take care of it the next day. But it wasn't taken care of. I wiped it off myself. On the second night I had a paper grocery bag with trash from my dinner . The bag was left open so it was obvious to see that it was trash, and placed next to the trash can. House keeping didn't pick it up. Lastly I used up the 2 packet of coffee grounds and by day 3 housekeeping hadn't restocked the coffee or the creamer. I had to call the front desk and wait for it to be delivered. All thing considered, very disappointing

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect to use the pool or hot tub spa,as it has been closed for 6 months.
title: Not what we expected out of a Grandbourne Hotel
comment: Looking for a weekday getaway to relax and enjoy each other,is what we expected when we booked our 2 night stay. Upon arriving at this property,we quickly learned that simply was not going to be the case.The swimming pool had green alge throughout the bottom and the hot tub had a fence bolted to the opening to prevent it from being used.Then to find out it hasn't been open for 6 months was more upsetting.

title: Accounting department
comment: i stayed at the hotel for nearly 6 months. The staff in the lounges and restaurant were great as were the front desk associates. However the accounting department and management repeatedly had issues with crediting BPG points and gift certificates. I had to regularly remind them before I was helped.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very beautiful and relaxing with lots to do if you want.
title: Super Relaxing
comment: We've stayed at the Wild Horse Pass Resort and Spa twice. It's super relaxing and beautiful and the staff is great. It's a great family getaway with lots of things to do. The highlights for us are the horse back riding and super fast winding pool slide. The only negatives for us was that the water in the pools was cold and there is basically nothing in the nearby town of Chandler so you are kind of stuck eating at the hotel restaurants... which are fine... except for the pool bar. Not great food there. But Tempe is about 15 minutes away and there are lots of restaurants there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff was Terrific!
title: Great Business Stay
comment: Having stayed at many Grandbourne Properties and Resorts I have to say that the Belvoir Bucks County serves as a perfect spot for the business traveler in the area. The staff could not have been better and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The rooms could use an update to furnishings, but all in all a good stay if in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lot of history
title: One of My Favorite Older Hotels
comment: This is a great hotel with a lot of history, but a lot of modern amenites as well. Great workout room. Staff is very helpful. Right in the middle of business in Chattanooga. I stay here whenever I can.

title: This hotel is in a great location
comment: We were very excited to stay at this hotel due to the proximity to many of the different areas of Kansas City we would be visiting. Check in was easy and we liked the way the room was set up with the two double beds. The beds were horrible. You could tell by looking at them that they sagged in the middle which resulted in a horrible night sleep. It was a race to see who could get to the couch first. The next morning we requested a room change so we could all sleep better and they accommodated, apologized, and said that they would make sure someone checks the beds in our first room. The second night we slept fine and the beds were comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: A LOCALIZAǃO PRIVILEGIADA. O CONFORTO QUE PROPORCIONA AO HOSPEDES.
title: ESTE HOTEL ɠMUITO BOM
comment: O Belvoir SEATTLE EST`LOCALIZADO EM UM PONTO PRIVILEGIADO DA CIDADE, ɠAO LADO DO CONVENTION CENTER, TORNANDO-O UM PONTO ESPECIAL PARA PARTICIPANTES DE EVENTOS NESTE CENTRO.

everyoneShouldKnow: No nice restaurant for dining during the week.
title: This hotel is missing important features
comment: We were deeply disappointed that the hotel had no formal dining facility, only a Pub. Not exactly a place to spend an impotant anniversary or other special occasion. Would like to have been able to lock valuables in a room safe.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff doesn't live up to the infrastructure.
title: Good infrastructure, subpar staff, missing package
comment: The staff first confirmed that my mother could stay longer than originally planned and the last day of the original reservation they said they were overbooked and my mother couldn't stay so we had to make last-minute and costly arrangements. Also, I received a package from Amazon but the hotel staff failed to deliver it to me and now they are not offering a solution for this.

everyoneShouldKnow: Horrible Service
title: Filthy Hotel and Service
comment: I paid extra for Resort View and never got one. I was put on a floor that was scheduled for renovation. When we returned in the evening the entire floor was begin renovated and our room was sealed. I can provide pictures of room and floor we were put.

everyoneShouldKnow: Well above average price yet inferior service
title: bad service and room arrangement
comment: No water in the room even though I'm a BPG Platinum. I had to call and wait for a while at midnigh just to get a water.

title: facility a bit old, service OK
comment: old hotel, connenient to major highways. service was OK

title: Does Gold status really mean anything?
comment: It used to be when I checked into a BPG property I would get upgraded beyond a basic room. That no longer seems to happen. I also used to receive bottled water, that also seems to be a thing of the past. While I know this property is being upgraded, the room and particularly the bathroom are highly dated and need serious work to be at the level of a Belvoir, that in my opinion, continues to impress me less and less with each stay at various properties.

title: Good, newer roperty and good location
comment: The Belvoir Jacksonville is a good location for business, outa of the downtown area but close enough for an easy commute in to the city. Right off the 9A and JTB (FL 202) makes airport needs convenient while close enough to the beaches and good restaurants. There is also a good restaurant in the facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: How dirty it is!
title: HORRIBLE
comment: Thank you for letting me share my HORRIBLE experiences with the Belvoir Towers in Times Square. Upon walking into my first room on the 25 floor (after a long day at work) the FIRST thing I saw was BLOOD on the wall - BLOOD!. It was not a lot but JUST the fact that there was BLOOD on the wall completely freaked my out - AND grossed me out. I mean, if there is blood on the wall that NO ONE cleaned, then what else have they NOT cleaned. I get a second room. This room was still dirty - totally covered with food on the walls. Then to top it ALL off on my third (and last night) with the Belvoir, I had a HORRIBLE wake up at 11:30pm when security pounded on my door yelling "get up, who's in this room". Again I was SO freaked out. I didn't open the door but asked "why". All he said back was "call the front desk and tell them who's in the room". I was so confused because I had been in the room for two nights already. I called down and the front desk proceeded to tell me that my name 'wasn't' on a reservation' and therefore security was doing a check. WHY would they do this; a) at 11:30pm and WHY would they not have CALLED my room at an earlier time to verify!. Overall worst hotel experiences I've ever had. I will never stay there again and please know that I will be sharing this with my company who booked off the block of rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: They go so far above and beyond the call of duty to exceed expectations.
title: You (truly do) Belong
comment: Many companies these days use taglines and advertising jingles because they sound nice but then fall short on delivering on their promises. The Belvoir brand tagline - "You Belong" - is one of those instances where a company delivers more than promised. You truly do feel like You Belong when you stay at the Belvoir Orlando North. The staff here go so far above and beyond the call of duty to make your stay so comfortable that you'll want to call this place home for longer than required. They deliver true and gracious HOSPITALITY, not just service. I have been blown away on so many occasions by the little (or big) extra lengths their staff here go to in ensuring expectations aren't just met but blown away that there is no way I could recount them all here. In short, I have stayed more than 700 nights in hotels spanning six continents in the last 3 years and the Belvoir Orlando North staff has done more to make each stay here memorable and remarkable than any other.

everyoneShouldKnow: DO NOT stay here if it's a warm November... they switch over to heat at a certain time of year and can not put the air back on!
title: Unacceptable
comment: We walked into an uncomfortably hot, muggy room upon arrival. Turned off the heat but noticed there was no air. Called downstairs and they said they would send someone up. No one ever came up. I caught an employee passing by in the hallway (since we had the door opened, trying to get some cool air in the room) and she came in and stood on the desk to open the window, she also said she would send someone up with a fan and that never happened either. None of us got any sleep because having a window wide open in NYC can be pretty loud! Customer service was terrible. I would not recommend this hotel. The location is perfect but you can't get any sleep. Way to hot and bad customer service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Overrated
title: Sad, Sad, Sad
comment: My hotel room was dirty, TV only worked when it wanted to, multiple outlets in the room didn't work, and shower drain was clogged. During any shower, I would have to stop the shower three (3) times to let the water slowly drain. And lastly, most of my colleagues who were also staying in this hotel had several issues with their rooms too.

title: Good recovery
comment: My stay started out poorly. Room was not clean. I left a message for the Hotel manager which must have gotten lost. I called back and Josh took the call. He addressed all of my concerns and gave me great recommendations on where to go. He did a great job. As a result i'll be staying there now again this week.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you get an email offer prior to your arrival to upgrade to Club Floor for $20, you must do it ! We did and it was the best decision.
title: Excellent staff & BPG status recognition but one of our rooms was not properly cleaned
comment: First 3 nights on Biz (Club Floor Tower), first got a King and found the room to be too small, changed to two double beds room, enjoyed it and had a very pleasant stay. 4th night on leisure, Executive Suite (2 queens), asked if there was any difference between the Plaza and Tower Buildings, was told no, so I went with the Tower one as it is near Club Lounge, had a horrible night with one of the two heaters not working, extremely small bathroom (reminded me of my trip to Europe), room was not properly cleaned (found out when we were ready to fall asleep at 1am), took some photos and showed them to one of the managers on duty in the morning so that next customers won't get to see what we saw. 5th night, had to change to a King Suite at Plaza, which was much better and so comfortable. I will never stay at a 2-Queen Suite in Tower again.

everyoneShouldKnow: That there is a ridiculous valet parking charge, per day, even for guests of the hotel
title: Shock and awe!
comment: Everything about the hotel was wonderful in terms of my two-day stay. However, since it is in an area where parking could be at a premium, the hotel has valet parking for both guests and visitors. While I understand charging visitors, I am appalled, shocked, and angry that as a guest, you are charged an additional $32 per day to valet your car. Even more serious is the fact that nothing specifies this particularly high fee when you make a reservation. Of course they don't, why would they be forthcoming about an extra fee like this? A shame on an otherwise very nice experience, and this from an BPG Gold status (current) member!

everyoneShouldKnow: If you expect friendly and attentive staff, avoid this hotel.
title: An underwhelming experience
comment: Compared to other Belvoir hotels I've stayed in, this one left me wanting more.

title: Multiple Issues
comment: Alarm went off twice due to moisture from shower and I was told that is normal. Ridiculous.

title: Felt like a Queen
comment: Reading some of the previous reviews I'm thinking maybe they got the memo. After a tiring 3 1/2 hour drive the man at the desk was very kind and helpful. The next day, Michael, the concierge, did everything he could to get my questions answered. I stayed in the North Tower. The room was lovely as well as the view. The bathroom was definitely not small. My only complaint is no free wi-fi in the room?!

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location-great staff!
title: Great staff!
comment: The staff was very helpful as always. I have stayed at this location many times over the past few years. The hotel definitely need a renovation--it's a bit tired and the rooms are kind of dirty. The bed was comfortable and shower was good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and decor
title: Centrally located
comment: Very nice centrally located hotel. Staff were excellent. Room requires small repairs to make it great. Bed sinks in the middle and A/C heat fan is very noisy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking lot is very dimly lit.
title: Galleria
comment: The parking lot is very dimly lit. This is bad from a security standpoint and anyone walking to and from their car cannot see where they are going either. This should be a high priority and fixed immediately.Also the room that i was staying in was very loud. This was due to the motor of the elevator. The vibration could be heard through the room. Please note when people are making reservations that there will be an 8 dollar charge for the parking deck. This was an extra that I wasa not expecting.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be preparde for noise, and a poor HVAC system.
title: Avoid this property
comment: I wonder if I stayed at the same property that others have reviwed. This Hotel has a horrible HVAC system.

title: Restaurant and safe
comment: I had breakfast at the Atrium. Surprisingly the muffins were awful. They were not fresh. You should have a much better offering for breakfast.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lack of Customer Focus (anticipating customers needs)
title: Lacking Customer Focus
comment: We were celebrating our anniversary and going to a cruise the next day. We paid and additional $150 for an upgrade. The arrived at 2:37PM and had to wait until 4:20PM for our room. When asked if I could get any coupons for the inconvenience I was told I have an upgrade room therefore none was necessary. I stated i PAID for the upgrade. In addition a couple in line before me (gentlemen was handicap) requested an upgrade room and they were denied. When I inquired about my upgrade I was at first denied but I had proof that mine upgrade was already approved. When we got our room (suite) it was an handicap room with auto doors etc... That's not right!

everyoneShouldKnow: Outstanding staff customer service and attentiveness.
title: Outstanding Service
comment: I've had the pleasure of staying with the hotel for over 76 days. I have yet to find another hotel that offers such exceptional quality customer service as the Belvoir Jacksonville.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Need to alert guests in advance if the President is coming to the hotel!
comment: I would like to have been alerted to the fact that President Obama was going to be attending an event at this hotel during my stay. This caused a huge inconvenience to the guests trying to enter and exit the hotel as the streets and entrances were blocked off with NYPD for several hours.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to the airport and rental cars
title: Great Hotel
comment: This is my favorite hotel in San Diego. It is close to the airport, with great views and outstanding employees. The food is great and the ambiance makes one feel comfortable and important. As a platinum member I always get upgraded and the concierge lounge is a great place to relax.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to Bush International Airport
title: Some Improvements Are Needed
comment: It appears you have removed the Fox News channel from you cable service. Please re-instate is as that is the news channel for many professionals.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rest of the staff was okay but they have a very poor attitude on the part of mgmt. they see you as a paid reservaion only, you are not treated as a guest.
title: very disappointing
comment: I stayed here with my 86 year old mother and after a miserable night with the heater malfunctioning the desk manager offered us a free buffet breakfast. My husband called the hotel and after being blown off a couple times was told by a famale asst, she would talk to staff an call us the next day. Of couse It never happened.

title: No wi-fi
comment: The hotel really should have wi-fi. It is 2011 and a nice resort like this should have it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great bar - just don't stay overnight in the dirty rooms.
title: A real dog with fleas
comment: Nice lobby & bar. Staff is friendly. My room was a DUMP - stained carpet, dirt & food on the floor, and no soap in the bathroom. Only one bath towel. Are you kidding? I'm sleeping in my clothes tonight! I told the staff, but there's nothing they can do - hotel is sold out. STAY AWAY from this place.

title: Poor Hotel
comment: Would not recommend. Staff was not helpful and rude at times. My reservation consistently got messed up even though I was assured time after time that it wouldn't be. Also got a lot of unexpected fees.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you collect BPG - go for the Westin or Westin Grand
title: not to return
comment: I have stayed at the Belvoir Seattle many times and this will be my last visit. The bathroom was not clean and the front desk staff and bell staff were very unfriendly and did not make me feel welcome. I was at the Westin Seattle in October and they have my vote. Belvoir - it's time to step up your service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location
title: Clean, quiet and close to Manhattan
comment: Better than expected, great location to Newark airport and Manhattan.

everyoneShouldKnow: ideal location
title: perfect location
comment: great location! only negative check in process..huge lines..room not available when I arrived (not unexpected) but told to come back in an hour..another huge line (got request wrong for 2 beds not one); correted; told to come back in another hour...another huge line...request for 2 beds still wrong and not in system; told to come back in 2 more hours; huge line, again "wrong" request for 2 beds, room not ready-- at 8 pm line not so long, room ready..but only one bed! had to be swapped for a different room; line too huge to check out next day; need more front desk staff; & better communication

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer Service is everything!
title: Would definitely stay here again!
comment: We used our Grandbourne Points to pay for the two rooms and I must say, the people working the Preferred Guests desk were eager to service our needs despite being sold out. It was extremely busy! One nasty rep can ruin a hotel stay but each and every person had a smile on their face. We had a delightful stay. Our rooms were warm, however. We attempted to adjust the temp but to no avail so we opened the window just a crack and we were comfortable.

title: Wasted Starpoints
comment: At the BPG agent's suggestion, I used 29,000 Starpoints to get 2 rooms (14,500 ea) on the Preferred Guest floor. On arrival, we got one room but the hotel said no rooms with doubles were available on those floors and we were placed in a double room on another floor. We could have had this room for 12,000 points so we wasted 2,500 points.

everyoneShouldKnow: great service
title: Excellent hotel and service
comment: We had a wonderful stay at the Belvoir Boston Hotel. We took our 6 year old there for a long weekend and she had a blast. Great views from the 26th floor, really nice pool, incredibly helpful concierge and staff, impressive complimentary continental breakfast with terrific views of the river, and little extras like warm cookies and hot cider made the trip even more special. We'll definitely be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ask for a river view room...great view!
title: Nice Hotel
comment: On the positive side, I found the hotel to be nice and well kept. Personnel were very courteous, polite, and helpful. The room was nice, albeit somewhat worn, and the view of the river from the 22nd floor was exceptional. A couple downsides were that the prices in the hotel restaurant were very high and the room was dusty and needed vacuuming.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Great location for activities in Denver
comment: Perfect location for accessing anything in downtown Denver. The hotel is nicely updated and clean. We self parked instead of using valet. The parking was confusing and difficult to exit. The fitness center was large with a lot of great workout equipment but it was so hot it made it difficult to workout.

everyoneShouldKnow: Boutique charm, friendly staff, convenient location.
title: Lovely Hotel & Great Location
comment: The Gunter is a lovely boutique hotel located 2 short blocks from the riverwalk, 4 to the Alamo, a trolley stop at the door, with restaurants, drug store, bagels and coffee shop nearby. What else could you want? Super helpful & friendly staff, stately charm and just the right amount of elegance with lovely rooms and comfy beds. I was MORE than pleased with our stay. We loved the old hotel switchboard on display in the lobby. I would recommend the Gunter to anyone. It was a perfect gem, glad we found it.

everyoneShouldKnow: The happening place in TSQ
title: Great Hotel
comment: Always a great place to stay. Gets crowded but lots of fun. Check in lines can be very long if you get in at the wrong time. This Belvoir is the place to be.

everyoneShouldKnow: In-hotel restaurants are expensive and you'll spend about the same amount in cab fares trying to eat elsewhere.
title: Conference was great!
comment: Just had a 3 day international conference at the hotel utilizing space in both the Marina and Bay towers.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Decatur Street and Cafe Du Monde.
title: It was a decent hotel.
comment: The beds were very comfortable but my King room that was reserved for me ended up being 2 queen beds as my room had been given away before my arrival.

everyoneShouldKnow: Unreasonable cost for use of internet. I am a military person and a Grandbourne Preferred Guest (BPG) and expect a much lower rate
title: Nice Hotel - Convenient location to Convention Center
comment: Nice Hotel, very convenient to attend show at the Convention Center. Unreasonable cost to use internet.

title: Very relaxing
comment: Very relaxing. Good food, good service

everyoneShouldKnow: Very helpful staff.
title: Always our first choice
comment: Great hotel. Very helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are clean and tastefully decorated. I couldn't give it 5 stars because the indoor pool was dirty and had some green stuff in it.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location
title: Staff could be more cheerful
comment: I have stayed at this Belvoir on the Plaza many times. Each time I stay, I leave with the feeling that the front desk staff are slightly rude and not very friendly at all....almost annoyed that they have to welcome you and check you in. One time I booked with an online hotel company and it was OBVIOUS the desk guy was unhappy with that (though the Belvoir releases rooms to these companies like Expedia, Orbitz, etc...) This time I booked thru Belvoir and got a package deal, which they only partially honored. This has happened several times in the last 2 years. It's never enough to cause me to not come back....the location is wonderful and I can usually get a good price online. I just wish the desk crew would be more cheerful and actually act like they are glad you chose to stay at the Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you pay extra for a renovated room, ask the front desk and verify you will ACTUALLY be in a renovated room.
title: Hotel not up to par
comment: I am a Grandbourne preferred member and I booked a room, on a higher floor because I was under the impression I would be staying in a newly renovated room, that I paid extra for. This sadly, was not the case. Upon arrival, there was a line to check in. It moved fairly quickly. The room was not a newly renovated room, or at least, did not appear to be renovated. The sink leaked water, and the paint needed a touch up. The view was horrible. So after paying extra for a renovated room, I was very disappointed. The staff, however, was friendly and helpful. My husband and I were in town for the Margarito/ Cotto fight. We left our room and when we tried to open our door, the keys did not work. We were given new keys, and went on our way. The next day, we left for the fight and made sure our keys worked, which they did. When we arrived back to our room, very late, our keys did not work, again. We went downstairs, got new keys, informed the front desk this was the second time this had happened. We went to our room, which we couldn't get into because yet AGAIN our keys did not work. My husband went back downstairs to get new keys, which did not work either, so security had to come again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very friendly staff.
title: Great Staff
comment: I relocated from another hotel in town due to a noise issue. It was my first time staying in the Anchorage Belvoir and the hospitality of the employees made my stay enjoyable.

title: Great Hotel
comment: We stayed on a club level floor in which the room was large, clean and impecably decorated. I was a bit nervous after reading other reviews but the hotel far exceded what I had expected. We were there during a warm holiday weekend and the entire city was packed but they hotel had us checked us quickly and were quicj to answer any questions we had. We had an issue with the room next to us, which they immedately looked into, although not resolved to my liking we realize only so much can be done with inconsiderate loud people.

everyoneShouldKnow: Go anywhere else.
title: very disappointing
comment: Right from the moment we arrived this hotel started to let us down. I reserved a King many weeks prior and they did not have that available. We ended up with the smallest room in the hotel. The halls were filthy, the cleaning staff very careless. A coffee spilled, that I reported, was never cleaned up.

everyoneShouldKnow: The city view rooms provide a beautiful view of the sun rising over New York.
title: Great View, Great Food
comment: Marinos food was AMAZING! Authentic and original Italian cuisine. Staff was friendly and helpful and the club room was a great perk. My room had a city view and i was able to watch the sun rise over New York, it was breathtaking!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect too much in terms of customer service
title: NOT what I expected
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir for a four-day LERN conference from 11/30 - 12/4. Reservations were made in September for this event and we waited in line for over 35 mins. just to check in----although I was lucky, several of my co workers had to wait until after 5pm (check in is supposed to be by 3pm) to even get checked in. There was no blow dryer in my room. I called 'guest services' to request one and the person I spoke to said they would send it right up---never saw it..AND although I like to think of myself as one who goes 'green'..if you opt to participate in the program, your room will not be serviced at all. Although I didn't need my bed made or linens changed, I would have appreciated the coffee service being replenished daily....after 2 days one is out of caffeinated coffee. I'm torn as to whether I'll stay here again and if business does take me back to New Jersey, I'll likely look to exhaust all other options before choosing to stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Two Towered Large Hotel
title: Centrally Located Downtown Seattle Hotel - Belvoir Hotel
comment: Over Thanksgiving weekend 2011 I stayed at the Belvoir Seattle for three nights. I stayed Thursday - Sunday. It was a very busy hotel, centrally located within walking distance to many places including shopping, a holiday parade, gingerbread holiday house, the famous Seattle Market, The Triple Door club, etc. We had a vehicle and the hotel is easily accessed from I-5 with no trouble at all. While the drive way can get busy at times, we ordered up our car with no problem during the busiest time of the day right after the end of the downtown parade and the staff was fast and professional. Our room was a corner room in the Union St tower ending in #51. It's has a bit more room that other standard room and due to the size of that tower, it seemed like a quieter portion of the hotel. We had access to the Club Room and it was well maintained, kept clean and well staffed. We used in mainly for breakfasts which were very crowded, but the staff working the room kept it clean, refreshed and moving. There was never a wait. We used the facilities including pool and workout room. The pool is a manageable size and our kids loved splashing around. It was loaded with kids over that weekend so it was pretty packed, but that is to be expected. We used room service and it was timely and correct. The housekeeping staff was exceptional and courteous. Jin was our floor's housekeeper and she was timely, kind and nice. I have stayed here many times and would recommend it for business and/or family stays. I will tell you that it is a very large hotel so if you are looking for a boutique hotel, this is not it. But for the competitive prices I paid for a large hotel it fulfilled all our needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is on the north side of Orlando and far, far away from Disney, if that is your destination. Universal is much closer.
title: Robert
comment: I recently spent three nights at the Belvoir Orlando North hotel. The hotel is very nice and the staff is extremely friendly. I was attending a week long course at a nearby facility so the location was ideal for me. Winter Park and Altamonte Springs are within 10 minutes as well. The hotel is bigger than it looks. My room was on the 4th floor and was a hike to get too. However, it was a very comfortable and clean room. I would have expected the rate I paid to be much more for this room. The guidlines for writing a review forbids me to list the exact rate I paid, but tax incuded, it was under $100 per night for the standard 2 queen beds room. The room was dressed in a rich Mahogany wood decor with granite bathroom countertops. My bathroom was impecably clean, which is always a concern when traveling. The beds are very comfortable, but are a little noisy from the protective bed covering under the sheets. I know hotels want to protect the mattresses, but the covers are annoying. Also the air conditioner is a wall unit and is a bit loud (Just mildly loud) at night, if you need absolute quite to sleep. I was able to use the hotel computers for studying at night without any additional internet costs, which was nice. I thought the food on the hotel menu was considerably overpriced though. A $15 hamburger? That better be the best burger in Florida. All in all, the hotel is a great place to stay, especially for the price. I will definitely stay again if I am in this area overnight.

everyoneShouldKnow: Upgrade to the lounge level if you like the additional attention from the staff in the lounge.

comment: I have stayed at the Belvoir several times and this hotel is in a great location for the theater, Times Square, and Radio City Music Hall. The staff are friendly too. If you stay on the club level you have access to the lounge. Tommy and Barbara are there in the evenings serving drinks and appetizers and are very pleasant and wonderful to talk to about anything. They will make your stay fun. Don't forget they are waitstaff and do not share their tips. I noticed everyone tipping Barbara at the bar but not Tommy for his exceptional service. The view is also great from the lounge.

Parking is plentiful and the indoor walkway to the convention center makes it fantastic to get to without even going outside. Definitely I'll plan to stay there again when attending a conference at the convention center.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff at every point of contact - lounge, front desk, concierge, catering, housekeeping - make you feel welcome.
title: Incredible staff at a conference hotel!
comment: Often conference hotels focus on the conference and not on the people attending - this hotel was different. It started with my check-in where they were quick and professional to get me checked in and to my room. As I opened the door to my room, I realized that the front desk had recognized my BPG level and had provided me an incredible room that was impeccably set up. There was even a welcome note and banana bread!

everyoneShouldKnow: Management needs to show more concern for their guests.
title: Disappointed in management
comment: On our rare and much anticipated weekend get-away we were awoken at 5:50am with a fire alarm that continued for 15 minutes at ear piercing decibels. Our night's sleep was rudely interrupted and prematurely over! The front desk told us it was a false alarm and to stay in our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff does its Job very well - expect cleanness of rooms above standards and maintenance too.
title: A very pleasant Stay!
comment: This is one of the best Belvoir Hotels I have been in.

everyoneShouldKnow: great downtown location
title: I'm so glad you asked...
comment: We had an absolutely wonderful experience. The staff was warm and welcoming, completely took care of our room needs. The hotel and room was perfect. The pool not being open was a disappointment to my grandkids, but, there was ice on the deck. I wonder if it would be feasible to have a heated deck to melt off the ice? Anyway, all in all, we were very happy customers. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: Bad Service
title: Very Poorly Operated and Dirty
comment: Staff was horrible, did not respond to requests and had to call several times to get an internet cable, was told I would just have to use internet in lobby even though I was staying at the hotel to work and needed it in my room. Very unprofessional. Did not call a cab when I asked them to schedule on, took an hour to get a cab. Food is overpriced and not very good. The elevators were filthy, floors in hotel were dirty. The room was fairly clean and as with most Belvoir hotels the bed was very comfortable. This hotel has the potential to be 4 star like many other Belvoir hotels but is operated worse than a 1/2 star hostel.

title: Great Place but avoid the bar
comment: I was there for the 42nd Annual SC Bluegrass Convention. I always like to stay at the Belvoir because it is super convenient to the convention. Its a very nice place to stay with a friendly staff, clean rooms, and great amenities. My "beef" with the place is that after the days performances my friends and I like to go down to the hotel bar, have a drink and enjoy the jam sessions of the bluegrass artists/hotel guests there for the weekend. The last couple years the same bar tender is there and is always rude and this past year he got into an argument with a lady in a wheelchair and her husband. Plus I asked for one top shelf long island iced tea and he told me that it would cost me $30...needless to say I didn't drink a $30 drink. The drink I did get wasn't all that great. IN CONCLUSION .... I would give this place a 100% rating if it wasn't for that bar tender that has been there for the past several years.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bare basics. Lower your expectations for an enjoyable stay in the city.
title: Lower your expectations. Bare basics. But OK.
comment: First time at Belvoir New York. Overall, if you just need a place to sleep this hotel is OK. Don't expect much else.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location
title: A very busy hotel in NYC
comment: The timing of our stay was the week-end when Madison Sq Gardened had a fight night so the hotel was packed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Unbeatable location in NYC, not much else to recommend it.
title: Location is its only redeeming feature
comment: Unbeatable location - would not return here for any other reason. Room was not ready at 2:45 - had to leave and return and stand in line yet again. (Apparently dozens or even hundreds of rooms became instantly available 15 minutes later.) Two of the four elevators going to floors up to 20 were not working day we checked in - horrendous lines and congestion in the lobby and elevator corridors. One evening I came back to my room only to find five or six housekeeping trolleys in the corridor - they were still there five hours later, with no evidence that anyone was working on servicing the rooms. I complained to Guest Services, only to get someone with an attitude. The astronomical room rate should get something better than an attitude. We were supposed to receive a daily paper, but there were all of five or six papers sitting by the elevator each day. I suggest someone get the lead out and deliver a paper to each BPG room.

title: Very nice hotel
comment: Very clean and beautifully decorated. The staff was outstanding and very helpful.

title: This hotel fell short of my expectations.
comment: I've stayed in cheaper hotels that were actually better than this. This room stay was mediocre - just OK. In short --- the Internet in the room was not free (had to pay $10/day), towels smelled slightly of cigarette smoke, bathroom fixtures leaked a bit, heat system never shut off and ran 24/7 (loud), and when I first entered the room the phones and lamps were not even plugged in. I had to go around the room in the dark and plug everything in so I could turn everything on. Granted these are all little issues but not what I expected for a $160/night room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel president said if you're stay isn't a ten, I want to know why. It was a ten!
title: We're coming back with family and friends!
comment: Almost everyhthing was above expectations. Loved the beds, the room, beautiiful view of city, healthy food choices, convenience of club services and friendliness of staff. Only issue was that two staff members didn't know what's included with Grandbourne Preferred Guest membership.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location in St. Louis. Central to every part of the city.
title: Great Location
comment: As with most Grandbourne properties, the service and location were great. Parking was easy and they offerred a discount for combining parking and internet service for the room. I had two issues with the room, however. The room was cold, no matter how high I set the heater. Also, the wireless internet connection was just maddening. In and out with barely enough stability for me to get my work done.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is in DIRE need of renovation
title: Shocked
comment: I have made it a personal preference to stay in Grandbourne hotels whenever possible, however, this hotel should be demolished. My room had cigarette burned carpeting, stained carpets, and mold in the bathrooms. To make matters worse, this was for a room on the club level floor.

title: Terrible Room
comment: Terrible Room. I was placed in Room 202 which is behind the elevator shafts and has no windows. The elevators ran all night directly behind the headboard. The air conditioner ran approx 5 min out of every 20 minutes and was so loud I could not hear the television at full volume. I should have changed my room but didnt have time to contact the front desk until after the second night and didnt want the hassle for the final night. This room should never be used unless every other room is booked.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be prepared to have housekeeping knock on your door to see if you have check out yet.
title: Not worth the price
comment: Having stayed at other Belvoir hotels, I expected the Belvoir Downtown Orlando to meet the same standards. Upon arrival we found out we had no choice but to use the hotels valet service for 16 dollar + tax per night. The hotel had a huge parking lot next to it but self park was not an option.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location, but definitely not the best in the city
title: Far from the best experience
comment: As a platinum member; it would have been nice to have gotten an upgrade; my room was cold and boring; walls in bathroom had some stains; hotel needs to have wireless in the guest rooms

everyoneShouldKnow: needs better management and much improvement
title: Bad Experience at Nashville Belvoir
comment: I regret having to write this, but my saty at this hotel was a bad one. Not typical of Grandbourne stays. My room temp was hard to regulate. The wireless speed was horrible and I re-started many times as advised by staff with no improvement It was difficult to connect with varoius websites.The printer in the concierge Lounge was broken (not printing in middle of page/boarding pass)completely wasting my time trying to get to the airport. The TV remote control batteries were expired or the remote was broken, but was very inconvenient. I frankly expected a much better experience than the above for the rate I paid.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice Staff
title: Very friendly staff
comment: OK accomodations but extremely friendly and helpful staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff will try and make your stay a very pleasant one and will try very hard to meet your needs.
title: The silent professional
comment: I've been staying at this hotel since 2006 and I must say that It has come a long way in improvements and needs of customers.

title: strange room configuration
comment: Our king room was abnormally large with a lot of wasted floor space, however the bathroom was TINY. It had no counter space or cabinet to put any of your toiletries. It had been poorly renovated with slabs of granite on the tub surround, which did not even meet the tub itself. Large gaps with no caulking to even attempt to hide the poor workmanship. Bed was poorly made up, using a too-small flat sheet where a fitted sheet should have been, causing sleep on the bare mattress to occur. Not even a mattress cover was in place.
Very Nice Hotel. Staff and customer service were outstanding. Room was very nice and modern....good view.

title: Staff Amazing!
comment: I sent a long letter to the Belvoir site. Plz look it up. I named staff members by name. My stay over the last 3 months has been like staying with friends. The Belvoir felt like 'home away from home'.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for meetings. I walked almost everywhere!
title: Always fall short...
comment: The last time I stayed at this particular Belvoir I arrived around 8 pm, exhausted after a flight from Madison, WI and entered a room that had a bathroom that reeked of urine. Of course, the hotel was sold out and I had to make myself busy until the offensive odor was erased. With that memory in mind, I was very hesitant to book a room at this hotel. However, they offered a government rate and I had no other choice but to stay. When I arrived, I found out that they gave me an upgrade. Wonderful! I entered the room and was greeted with the fresh smell of Febreeze. Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: The remodel is a 180 from what this hotel was before.
title: Pleasant surprise for an airport hotel!
comment: I stayed at this hotel several years ago, and must admit it was one of the most depressing hotels I'd ever stayed in - it was horribly dated and just depressing. In the last year or so I stayed there again and was absolutely amazed at the difference - they have completely redone the hotel. As a platinum member, I stay at a good deal of hotels and this is one of the better Belvoir remodels I've seen. It's very comfortable. I also have to note that the hotel lounge isn't your typical lounge - I was very surprised (and pleased) at the excellent craft beer selection (kudos to the food/beverage manager!).

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful view, well-maintained property and terrific Sunday Buffet.
title: If only....
comment: I could easily give this hotel 5 stars if only they would be a bit more pet friendly...yes, they accept pets, and I am immensely grateful for that...but apparently the Love That Dog program has faded away or isn't active at this property for we were not even offered the bed/bowl etc. No problem as we travel with our own. But I find it a sticking point that pets could be in the lobby for check-in, and then are banished from "common areas". Yet they must use the hallway to get to the door to go out.... I am spoiled from other hotels, including Belvoirs, who welcome pets in the lobby area by the Link. Especially in the wee hours of the morning it isn't likely that a dog is going to be disturbing the majority of guests. Many of whom are happy to visit a pet. I also think charging about $18 for a movie that has come out on DVD is a bit over the top. People who are bothered by smoke should be aware that the outside door at the end of the room hallway has a large ashtray receptacle so that it draws some smokers and one has to walk by/through when following the dog rules to use that door for their walks. The room service rates are reasonable with access to a menu form their great restaurant. The rooms have fridges that don't seem to be cold enough to keep perishibles, thought I don't travel with a thermometer; and also have microwaves. At the end of the road (make a left out of the parking lot to the end, and then a quick right) is a Swensons's restaurant which has a nice variety of fast food, shakes, phosphates etc. Note if you don't like the sound of trains that you might prefer a non-river view. It is a lovely place to stay with very attentive staff and in general is very well maintained. I did note a sauce stain on the sofa, a stain on the carpet that i pointed out so my dog would not be accused, and the plug was missing from the bathub.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking area was a zoo
title: Parking is not very nice
comment: I stayed here on business for two nights. I arrived by car. I wanted to leave my car outside the lobby while I check-in. I didn't want the valet attendant move my car to the garage because I had to leave right away. The attendant was very rude and demanded that I must agree to the $43 valet parking fee before I could even leave my car! I have never had any hotel told me that I cannot leave my car outside for free when I check-in. I decided I was not going to park my car at Belvoir and demanded that I want my car left out front while I went inside to check-in. I was finally told that I could not leave my car there for more than 10 minutes.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk personnel are very professional and informative.
title: This hotel is very comfortable
comment: It is always a pleasure to stay in your San Diego location. It is very comfortable and clean. I was disappointed that purchases in the shop did not accrue BPG points. Otherwise, it is a fabulous hotel.

title: Second Home
comment: Almost every week, my wife and I travel to the Seattle and stay at the Belvoir Seattle. Great location, love the lobby, staff, and the view. They treat you very well here. Hope to use the "rooftop" pool next week!

everyoneShouldKnow: The room service food is great value and delicious
title: Fantastic rooms and location
comment: I travel to NYC several times a year and this is the first time at the Belvoir and must say i was so pleasantly surprised, I'm not sure I want to stay anywhere else. From the comfort of the room and bed to the furnishing and layout, my stay was fantastic. I had a minor niggle with the room safe which was fixed quickly each time but otherwise the room service, food and the maid service was fantastic and friendly. Loactionwise was also great as stepping onto 7th Avenue within sight of Times Square was amazing.

title: Bed spread had large dark stains on them... and staff didn't care.
comment: We stayed at this hotel for one night based on the location as we were arriving fairly late from the airport. Check in was slow as the front desk clerks were more interested in chatting with each other than checking us in.

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs more management involvement & improved cost. service
title: Disappointed with room and treatment as Gold member
comment: We have sstayed at this hotel for a number of visits to NYC. The reception and facilities this time have considerably deteriorated. The lGold Prefered Guest checkin in was cold, non responsive to my requests, didnt provide access to the Club Floor facilities, and didn't offer a room for about four hours after arrival. The room had a broken mirror taped together, a sink and stool that barely drained, cracked tile in the shower, very crowded conditions. and a brokenm shade pull for the window. This was definately not up to our expectations for Grandbourne facilities. When we asked for a room chjange we were told thotel was completely full and we were going to have to accepty what we had. Overall, we were treated poorly, charged $14.95 a day for lwhat should have been free WiFi, and not recognised / treated like valued customers.

everyoneShouldKnow: No valet, great parking garage access from inside hotel.
title: Quick stay
comment: Used this hotel to stay the night before an early flight. Close to DCA. Room nice for two. Really glad to see this hotel chain has improved the quality of their bath towels. I hate cheap towels. Nice updated TV's and coffee maker. Mattress was good, not the nicest I have had.

everyoneShouldKnow: The handicap room was appalling
title: Room condition was unacceptable
comment: As a result of BPG's failure to credit my 3 for 1 promotional points as promised, I was forced to transfer from the Manhattan (4 star) to the Belvoir (5 star) to a handicap accessible room a few days before my trip. Being a 5 star hotel I was shocked to find that the room was in horrible condition. The drapes were hanging and missing hooks which did not allow me to close them all the way and the swtich to raise the shade was broken. The radiator had peeling paint and worst of all, the bathroom had broken handles and was in the worst condition I've ever seen; and was more like a cheap motel than a 5 star hotel. Needless to say, I was appalled.

title: Excellent Accomodation
comment: The hotel guest rooms, conference facilities and personnel all exceeded my expectations. Bravo

title: Not Bad
comment: Confirmation didn't explain which tower we were in, consequently we arrived at the wrong tower! To avoid a 10 minute walk between towers, and to enable us to conveniently use the club room, Front Desk staff changed us to the main tower.

everyoneShouldKnow: They charge for parking.
title: Great hotel, bad weekend
comment: The room was very nice, the food at the bar was excellent, and the staff were very friendly. This stay would have been 5 star if I had stayed on another weekend. There was a football team/fans in the motel and it was noisy. I was awakened at 11:30 with the noise and I lay in bed until 12:30 thinking they would go to bed. After 12:30 I called the front desk, they alerted security, and by 1:30 the noise was gone, except for the banging on my door around 2:15. I got up quickly thinking something was wrong, but no one was there. I was also surprised that they charged for parking. It was $12 per day/unlimited or $8 every time you park.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is warm and friendly.
title: Great Staff
comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Belvoir property. The staff was so pleasant that we felt totally at ease. As Grandbourne Gold Preferred members we typically stay at the various Grandbourne properties and always find them well above the norm. This particular property is located in a business district; is close to a freeway; and very well maintained. Give it a try ... I think you'll enjoy your visit as well.

title: Great Overnight Stay
comment: My husband and I stayed over night while shopping in Myrtle Beach. The bed was super comfy! Great stay.

title: Parking
comment: We are very dissatisfied with the parking at the Belvoir Suites Country Club Plaza. When checking in we are asked if we have a car and then charged for parking. The parking is free for everyone else. garage entrance opens for everyone and the exit arm is always open. One evening there was no longer any spaces in the garage although we had paid for parking. When I complained to the manager I was told that the parking situation was not going to change. I was reimbursed for the parking charge, but it is a mystery why the Belvoir patrons are charged and everyone else parks for free

everyoneShouldKnow: Room is big. 7 minutes to airport and shuttles leave ON TIME
title: Lovely and Close to Airport
comment: Super Close to Airport. Shuttle Drivers were the best,..the best, friendly and helpful. I arrived quite late on a Friday and I got checked in instantly. Ask for a room that doesn't face..uh..the..weird and super ugly generator platform. Personnel here are top notch. Will return

everyoneShouldKnow: Dirty, service not so hot, convenient location, nice lobby and decent food. Nothing walking distance but a convenience store.
title: Needs Work
comment: The best part of this hotel is the entrance and lobby area of the main hotel. It is definitely a "hotel" so don't expect anything more. The food is decent. Our room was very dirty and stayed that way during our 4 day visit. The pool area was also dirty and there was no real service. It is well located in San Diego but there is nothing around it. We are BPG members and always use points for free stays. At 10,000 points per night it is not a deal at all and more of a let down.

title: Not up to standards
comment: Extremly nice people - property not up to Grandbourne standards.

title: The best of the Anaheim area Belvoirs
comment: There are three Belvoir hotels near Anaheim and Disneyland, and while this is the furthest away (by a whopping one mile!), it is, without a doubt, the best.

everyoneShouldKnow: A staff as great as the location!
title: Amazing location and staff!
comment: As soon as we walked in the door, everyone was incredibly welcoming and helpful. I asked if there was a room with a view of the City and was given one on the tenth floor looking directly at the Empire State Building. We watched the red holiday lights turn on at the same time the full moon came up over Canal Street. Beautiful!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, poor service
title: Service is sadly lacking
comment: Location is fabulous and the travel and tours representative was helpful. That is all there is to like about this Belvoir. It is one of the most expensive Belvoir I have stayed in, but one with sadly lacking service. I cannot believe that your priority number 1 is guest satisfaction.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to all the shops, restaurants, and art galleries in Old Town Alexandria. Just one block from the historic (since 1904) Royal Restaurant and 3 blocks from Trader Joes Market.
title: My First Time in Alexandria
comment: The front desk staff and courtesy drivers were very willing to drop me off at the Metro station and pick me up from various locations including the airport.

title: Anniversary Stay
comment: Overall we were pleased with our stay. The staff was very nice and attentive. We encountered a few glitches that were annoying, but didn't ruin our stay; they were just unexpected in what appeared to be such a nice place. Our key didn't work, someone was using a vacuum right outside our room at 6:45 am on a Sunday, and several of the breajfast buffet items were cold.

title: Interesting...
comment: Upon checking in, my room reservation was under my correct last name. Imagine my surprise upon checking out my last name has changed to. Hmmm....I asked how this occurred at the front desk and they had no real answer. Now I'm asked to complete a review under the wrong last name which I am a little disappointed in doing. Overall stay was OK, the party across from our room in the Presidential Suite was going on way into the early morning hours, oh well. Each time I started to call the front desk, it died down then picked up again etc. Oh well.

everyoneShouldKnow: They have a lot to work on.
title: Did not meet expectations
comment: I had high expectations when arriving to the Belvoir near the Philadelphia airport. I had previously stayed at the Aloft on a prior visit, and was very impressed. Arriving at the front desk, the lobby is very nice. The front desk staff was pretty incompetent; midway through check in she stops and tells me to hold on to help another customer who had forgotten to bring their credit card. A perfect example of what not to do in a customer service/ hospitality position. More on this later.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's undergoing renovations and you can hear drilling and noise from it in the room.
title: Another Disappointing Grandbournes Stay
comment: For the third time since becoming a Grandbourne member I did not receive an upgrade in my room. I received more upgrades when I wasn't a Gold member.

title: Difficult stay, but I would recommend this place
comment: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and would recommend it to others. It has absolutely beautiful views and of course is next door to the airport.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are amazing.
title: Amazing Hotel and Staff
comment: I had the wonderful experience to stay at this beautiful facility. The rooms are magnificent, the location is optimal and the restaurant terrific. Unfortunately, my friend and I had a medical issue and he experienced a heart attack while we were staying there. Carlisle at the front desk was the person who was kind enough to assist the paramedics and us with getting out of the hotel and to the hospital quickly. The entire staff inquired about my friend each time I went through the lobby and were so kind and caring, it was really touching and so nice to know that people like that still exist. A true asset to your facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: The parking is set up in a strange way, but otherwise it's a great hotel.
title: There is nothing bad about this hotel
comment: The valets are running all the time, the staff is always pleasant, the rooms are huge and comfortable and grounds are always kept clean. The food in the restaurant is also good quality.

title: Great stay
comment: We had a great room with excellent service...we will definately stay again!

title: Poor Room Quality
comment: Nice hotel in a great location but room quality was poor. Walls are very thin so you if you have rowdy neighbors, dont expect any sleep! No private balconies.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff at the Paparazzi bar are great.
title: Quality is Slipping
comment: This has been one of my favorite places to stay in LA. However, I have begun to notice a downward trend in the service and amenities over the past few stays. The club lounge used to be always open for a cup of coffee, or bottle of water or even just a spot to relax. Now, if you don't make it there during certain hours, you're out of luck. I definitely won't waste my money on a room upgrade anymore.

everyoneShouldKnow: Totally renovated property & has the best location.
title: WE LOVED THIS HOTEL ......WE WILL BE BACK!!
comment: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel-

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to the airport and the convention center.
title: The hotel was okay but not to my standards.
comment: The bathroom floor was wet when we first arrived (and the bathroom in general in tiny!) Also there was a hair on the bedsheet - yuck!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff
title: Great staff
comment: The facilities are currently under upgrade at the VA Beach Belvoir oceanfront so we understand the necessary lack of availability. What makes me a repeat customer here is the staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Functional but crowded...
title: Adequate plus
comment: I appreciate the new look of the property but find the hotel to be increasingly corporate and impersonal. The lobby is always crowded, noisy and busy (I guess that's good if you're the operator) and finding a place to sit in the bar area is nearly impossible. Squeezing the Link into the same area has made it even more congested so I always have appreciated having access to the 44th floor concierge lounge. Unfortunately, the remodeling of that space has made it far less appealing.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in a good location.
title: Location is the only good thing
comment: I was extremely disappointed during my recent stay. The Preferred Desk staff was surly, arrogant and unfriendly. They never used my name, and were brusque and robotic during check-in. The room was the worst I have ever had at this hotel. It was extremely tiny and had NO dresser or drawers. We had to literally live out of our suitcases for three days. Given the tiny, tiny size of the room, this made the space even more uncomfortable. The security staff they have in place in front of the elevators is a joke they NEVER once asked anyone to show room keys. Anyone and everyone who wanted to come in off the street and enter the room elevators had unfettered access. Obviously, the location of the hotel is great and that is the only thing I can recommend about this hotel. I certainly did not feel like a Gold BPG member and this stay made me question why I should remain loyal to the Grandbourne brand.

everyoneShouldKnow: really up-class, and visually appealing.
title: All was good, except...
comment: the room was great, but when i got in from my holiday party, i put in an order for room service for some food around 1AM. I called in to submit it, confirmed my room number. they told me the wait time was about an hour, and i was fine with that, sense it was late, and there were a lot of people coming in from the holiday party. so an hour and a half roles by and still no knock from room service, i called to check on my order, they said that "they just left i wouldn't be surprised if they where at your door now." so i waited for another half hour. called again then was told that an order was never submitted, at this point i was frustrated, so i didn't even bother. my guest still wanted food. so about 15 min later i placed another order for the same thing. got the same wait time, about an hour. and it actually came!

title: Jr Olympic trip
comment: I liked everything about the hotel but the following.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't stay anywhere else at LAX.
title: Outstanding Hotel
comment: This hotel gets less than perfect reviews on Yelp, mostly due to airplane noise. Hello it's NEXT TO AN AIRPORT. Trust the reviews here. The staff is the best I've ever encountered, even at 5 star resorts. I don't know if they are a special breed or get paid $100k a year, but man are they happy and excited to make your stay the best it can be, no matter if you are in for a week or just a few hours.

everyoneShouldKnow: GPS on 2 devices does NOT get you to the hotel, it gets you to the parking lot a block away, so it is hard to find w/gps
title: Amazing staff..nice location
comment: This hotel & staff are awesome. Family from LA came out for a week and we needed a larger room but were on a budget. Not knowing the neighborhood, we were pleasantly surprised at the proximity of the downtown Brooklyn shopping and transportation options. I can't say enough about the warmth of the staff, they gave us a room with a spectacular view for a modest upgrade fee. We were with a teen & early twenty something & felt comfortable letting them get around the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's very family friendly.
title: Incredible service
comment: I would recommend this hotel to any individual and/or family. The staff members were extremely friendly and helpful to my entire family. The suite was clean and spacious and offered beautiful views of Dallas. We plan to visit Dallas each year and will definitely be staying here again and again!

title: Army Navy Stay
comment: The hotel was very helpful to my family and friends during our stay for the Army-Navy game. They provided transport for our group of 8 to old town for shopping and dinner and to National airport. All we had to do is ask and they worked it out.. We had to walk 8 blocks to the metro (they would have talen us) but that was my wife's idea to keep me healthy and my knees sore..Would stay again

everyoneShouldKnow: They go out of their way to make you feel welcomed and important.
title: Very, very hard working and friendly staff
comment: Christmastime in New York. Very, very busy time, and stress is at an elevated level with shoppers and customers. I saw everyone from the front desk crew, to the bellman, to the Concierge, to the management display class, helpfulness, and smiles. Outstanding staff, excellent new, upgraded rooms at a fair price for New York. My first choice when coming to the city!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel, great location!
title: Great welcome back to the US!!
comment: Stayed here my first night home after 9 months in Iraq, and the staff was AWESOME! Friendly, helpful and outgoing! Hotel was SPOTLESS and obviously well maintained.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect Location
title: Great Location, Rude Staff
comment: The hotels location is perfect. Close to times square, subways, central park, and shopping. Staff at the front desk are rude and do not care for your needs one bit. Even if you are a Gold or Platinum BPG member. Apparently what I was told was there are no upgrades for us at this hotel. On the bright side the staff in the breakfast buffet are the nicest people in the hotel. They even remember your name each day you come in. Very outstanding.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location
title: Elevator Issues
comment: This is a very convenient location to the French Quarter and the shopping on Canal.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great value!
title: Everything stellar except for eating establishments
comment: Beautiful clean lobby, Ernst at the front desk went out of his way to get me the best room possible. Room was terrific, and they even brought an extra couch. The bed was the most comfortable I ever slept on, and the bathroom was truly sparkling clean, like on Lysol tv ads:))) Amazing! Bell boy was on time and super helpful, and the cleaning lady too.

everyoneShouldKnow: Appealing
title: Outstanding!

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs a lot of work.
title: Did not meet expectations
comment: I had high expectations when arriving to the Belvoir near the Philadelphia airport. Arriving at the front desk, the lobby is very nice. The front desk staff was pretty incompetent; midway through check in she stops and tells me to hold on to help another customer who had forgotten to bring their credit card. A perfect example of what not to do in a customer service/ hospitality position. More on this later. The room decor was nice. Some peeling wallpaper here and there, which gives it a tackier/cheap feel than I would have expected, but overall nice and comfortable bed. Room service leaves a lot to be desired; my girlfriend has a dust allergy and was sneezing almost constantly. She is a barometer for airborne dust, and this place was full of it. Even if she wasn't allergic, if you could run your finger across the dresser and see the dust. What is the staff doing here? Obviously they're spending time in the room, but what are they even doing? I know this because a shirt was missing from our room. We found this out when turning in for bed, a pajama shirt was missing. An honest mistake on part of the staff, but what was the worst part was the customer service (or lack thereof). After calling the front desk, who seemed to totally not care and just wanted to wipe their hands of it, we filed a report with security. The security was helpful, a little smug. They told us to call before 6am on our checkout day. Why do we have to call? Why don't you call us? We called. We still don't have the shirt. Note this. The last straw is breakfast room service. Do not get this. We paid 60+ dollars for an Ihop style breakfast. Ihop in quality and size (if not smaller). Besides this, the form to order and put on your doorknob was highly misleading. If I check off one american breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, orange juice, and wheat toast, does that mean they send a serving of each of those to every person in the room? This is apparently how their minds work. THe breakfast was room temp at best. The staff called about 30 mins after delivering the breakfast to ask how it was. When I said it was cold i was met with a "I see....okay. hmm." Very helpful..why are you even calling me? I was expecting a lot from the Belvoir. I was disappointed on almost every level. The staff is incompetent, not very helpful or caring. When I went downstairs to purchase something from the grab and go snacks, I get a big earful of a graphic and violent conversation between a front desk staff (male) and a kitchen worker who appeared to be leaving for the day. Food is overpriced. Location is fine. I just expected so much more. When staying at a Grandbourne establishment you expect your visit to be easy and comfortable. This one has a lot to work on. Keep this in mind when choosing this hotel. It definitely was the low point of my weekend visit unfortunately.

However, a potentially excellent stay was marred by exceedingly poor sound insulation in the rooms. The noise between rooms is so bad, you may was well do away with the walls and have everyone sleep in the conference centre. On two nights we had shouting and general conversation going on in both adjoinging rooms in the early hours of the morning (3am.) Also loud shouting in the corridors and banging on doors. I accept that this is outside of the control of the hotel, but expected that on the club floor of the hotel that this would not be as bad. The sound proofing in the rooms (considering they are newly renovated) is unacceptable. I am a platinum card holder with Grandbourne so travel very frequently and this exceeds any experience I have had anywhere in the world by quite some margin!
